title: Question of the Week: What’s The Strangest Thing You’ve Found in a Car?
description: Welcome to the BaT Question of the Week! For those unfamiliar, here are the rules: we ask an automotive-themed question, and the author of our favorite answer from the comments is awarded a $25 credit to the BaT Gear Store. This week’s question is: What’s the strangest thing you’ve found in a car? Last week’s Question of the Week (best in-car object recovery) got us thinking about the doodads, whatchamacallits, and thingamajigs that we’ve found by chance—old personal belongings, strange mystery objects, even living things. Whether it was in a car that you let a friend borrow or from an archaeological exploration of your newest project vehicle, we want to hear about your most peculiar finds!
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Learn more about Question of the Week: What’s The Strangest Thing You’ve Found in a Car? on Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online.
text: Welcome to the BaT Question of the Week! For those unfamiliar, here are the rules: we ask an automotive-themed question, and the author of our favorite answer from the comments is awarded a $25 credit to the BaT Gear Store. This week’s question is: What’s the strangest thing you’ve found in a car? Last week’s Question of the Week (best in-car object recovery) got us thinking about the doodads, whatchamacallits, and thingamajigs that we’ve found by chance—old personal belongings, strange mystery objects, even living things. Whether it was in a car that you let a friend borrow or from an archaeological exploration of your newest project vehicle, we want to hear about your most peculiar finds! Image: Hagerty While we know they’re out there, we kindly ask that you forgo the stories of illicit paraphernalia this week. With that slight caveat, we pass the mic over to you: What’s the strangest thing you’ve found in a car? Nominate your favorites in the comments, and give a thumbs-up to any other nominations you deem worthy. We’ll announce the winner on Monday.
html:
Welcome to the BaT Question of the Week! For those unfamiliar, here are the rules: we ask an automotive-themed question, and the author of our favorite answer from the comments is awarded a $25 credit to the BaT Gear Store.

This week’s question is: What’s the strangest thing you’ve found in a car?

Last week’s Question of the Week (best in-car object recovery) got us thinking about the doodads, whatchamacallits, and thingamajigs that we’ve found by chance—old personal belongings, strange mystery objects, even living things. Whether it was in a car that you let a friend borrow or from an archaeological exploration of your newest project vehicle, we want to hear about your most peculiar finds!

Image: Hagerty

While we know they’re out there, we kindly ask that you forgo the stories of illicit paraphernalia this week. With that slight caveat, we pass the mic over to you:

What’s the strangest thing you’ve found in a car?

Nominate your favorites in the comments, and give a thumbs-up to any other nominations you deem worthy. We’ll announce the winner on Monday.
